page.title: 04ECOLOGY ABERGAVENNY
page.content: AREA IS AGRICULTURAL - MAINLY PASTURE-GRAZED BY SHEEP, CATTLE, A FEW HORSES AND PIGS WILDLIFE INCLUDES RABBIT, HARES, FOXES,BADGERS,HEDGEHOGS RODENTS, WEASELS,REPTILES. FARMYARD FOWLS ARE OUTNUMBERED BY BATTERY HENS.LESS COMMON WILD BIRDS INCLUDE DUCK,CURLEW,SNIPE,OWLS,BUZZARD ETC. DISEASE AND MACHINE CUTTING HAVE THINNED HEDGEROW TREES BUT FEW HEDGES HAVE BEEN GRUBBED OUT. WILD FLOWERS HAVE BEEN REDUCED BY CROP SPRAYING BUT MANY VARIETIES REMAIN INCLUDING PRIMROSE,FOXGLOVE,CAMPIONS,WORTS, SPURGES AND TREFOILS. THE AREA CONTAINS SOME STREAMS AND RAINFALL AVERAGES 30INS PER ANNUM. MANY FOOTPATHS ARE LITTLE USED.
